name: ResearchElementDefinition
description: The ResearchElementDefinition resource describes a "PICO" element that knowledge (evidence, assertion, recommendation) is about.

properties.name: ResearchElementDefinition
properties.short: A population, intervention, or exposure definition
properties.definition: The ResearchElementDefinition resource describes a "PICO" element that knowledge (evidence, assertion, recommendation) is about.
properties.comment: PICO stands for Population (the population within which exposures are being compared), Intervention (the conditional state or exposure state being described for its effect on outcomes), Comparison (the alternative conditional state or alternative exposure state being compared against), and Outcome (the result or effect of the intervention in the population).

properties.name: id
properties.short: Logical id of this artifact
properties.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
properties.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

properties.name: meta
properties.short: Metadata about the resource
properties.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

properties.name: implicitRules
properties.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
properties.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
properties.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

properties.name: language
properties.short: Language of the resource content
properties.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
properties.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

properties.name: text
properties.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
properties.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
properties.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

properties.name: contained
properties.short: Contained, inline Resources
properties.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
properties.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

properties.name: extension
properties.short: Additional content defined by implementations
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: modifierExtension
properties.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
properties.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: url
properties.short: Canonical identifier for this research element definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
properties.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this research element definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this research element definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the research element definition is stored on different servers.
properties.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.

The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions). 

In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

properties.name: identifier
properties.short: Additional identifier for the research element definition
properties.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this research element definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
properties.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this research element definition outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

properties.name: version
properties.short: Business version of the research element definition
properties.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the research element definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the research element definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.
properties.comment: There may be different research element definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the research element definition with the format [url]|[version].

properties.name: name
properties.short: Name for this research element definition (computer friendly)
properties.definition: A natural language name identifying the research element definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
properties.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

properties.name: title
properties.short: Name for this research element definition (human friendly)
properties.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the research element definition.
properties.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

properties.name: shortTitle
properties.short: Title for use in informal contexts
properties.definition: The short title provides an alternate title for use in informal descriptive contexts where the full, formal title is not necessary.

properties.name: subtitle
properties.short: Subordinate title of the ResearchElementDefinition
properties.definition: An explanatory or alternate title for the ResearchElementDefinition giving additional information about its content.

properties.name: status
properties.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
properties.definition: The status of this research element definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
properties.comment: Allows filtering of research element definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

properties.name: experimental
properties.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
properties.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this research element definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
properties.comment: Allows filtering of research element definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

properties.name: subject[x]
properties.short: E.g. Patient, Practitioner, RelatedPerson, Organization, Location, Device
properties.definition: The intended subjects for the ResearchElementDefinition. If this element is not provided, a Patient subject is assumed, but the subject of the ResearchElementDefinition can be anything.
properties.comment: The subject of the ResearchElementDefinition is critical in interpreting the criteria definitions, as the logic in the ResearchElementDefinitions is evaluated with respect to a particular subject. This corresponds roughly to the notion of a Compartment in that it limits what content is available based on its relationship to the subject. In CQL, this corresponds to the context declaration.

properties.name: date
properties.short: Date last changed
properties.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the research element definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the research element definition changes.
properties.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the research element definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

properties.name: publisher
properties.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
properties.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the research element definition.
properties.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the research element definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the research element definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the research element definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

properties.name: contact
properties.short: Contact details for the publisher
properties.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
properties.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

properties.name: description
properties.short: Natural language description of the research element definition
properties.definition: A free text natural language description of the research element definition from a consumer's perspective.
properties.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the research element definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the research element definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the research element definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the research element definition was created).

properties.name: comment
properties.short: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
properties.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the resource.

properties.name: useContext
properties.short: The context that the content is intended to support
properties.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate research element definition instances.
properties.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

properties.name: jurisdiction
properties.short: Intended jurisdiction for research element definition (if applicable)
properties.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the research element definition is intended to be used.
properties.comment: It may be possible for the research element definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

properties.name: purpose
properties.short: Why this research element definition is defined
properties.definition: Explanation of why this research element definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
properties.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the research element definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this research element definition.

properties.name: usage
properties.short: Describes the clinical usage of the ResearchElementDefinition
properties.definition: A detailed description, from a clinical perspective, of how the ResearchElementDefinition is used.

properties.name: copyright
properties.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
properties.definition: A copyright statement relating to the research element definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the research element definition.

properties.name: approvalDate
properties.short: When the research element definition was approved by publisher
properties.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.
properties.comment: The 'date' element may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes or editorial corrections.

properties.name: lastReviewDate
properties.short: When the research element definition was last reviewed
properties.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.
properties.comment: If specified, this date follows the original approval date.

properties.name: effectivePeriod
properties.short: When the research element definition is expected to be used
properties.definition: The period during which the research element definition content was or is planned to be in active use.
properties.comment: The effective period for a research element definition  determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 might be published in 2015.

properties.name: topic
properties.short: The category of the ResearchElementDefinition, such as Education, Treatment, Assessment, etc.
properties.definition: Descriptive topics related to the content of the ResearchElementDefinition. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of ResearchElementDefinitions that can be useful for filtering and searching.

properties.name: author
properties.short: Who authored the content
properties.definition: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

properties.name: editor
properties.short: Who edited the content
properties.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

properties.name: reviewer
properties.short: Who reviewed the content
properties.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

properties.name: endorser
properties.short: Who endorsed the content
properties.definition: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

properties.name: relatedArtifact
properties.short: Additional documentation, citations, etc.
properties.definition: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
properties.comment: Each related artifact is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.

properties.name: library
properties.short: Logic used by the ResearchElementDefinition
properties.definition: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the ResearchElementDefinition.

properties.name: type
properties.short: population | exposure | outcome
properties.definition: The type of research element, a population, an exposure, or an outcome.

properties.name: variableType
properties.short: dichotomous | continuous | descriptive
properties.definition: The type of the outcome (e.g. Dichotomous, Continuous, or Descriptive).

properties.name: characteristic
properties.short: What defines the members of the research element
properties.definition: A characteristic that defines the members of the research element. Multiple characteristics are applied with "and" semantics.
properties.comment: Characteristics can be defined flexibly to accommodate different use cases for membership criteria, ranging from simple codes, all the way to using an expression language to express the criteria.

properties.name: id
properties.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
properties.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

properties.name: extension
properties.short: Additional content defined by implementations
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: modifierExtension
properties.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
properties.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: definition[x]
properties.short: What code or expression defines members?
properties.definition: Define members of the research element using Codes (such as condition, medication, or observation), Expressions ( using an expression language such as FHIRPath or CQL) or DataRequirements (such as Diabetes diagnosis onset in the last year).

properties.name: usageContext
properties.short: What code/value pairs define members?
properties.definition: Use UsageContext to define the members of the population, such as Age Ranges, Genders, Settings.

properties.name: exclude
properties.short: Whether the characteristic includes or excludes members
properties.definition: When true, members with this characteristic are excluded from the element.

properties.name: unitOfMeasure
properties.short: What unit is the outcome described in?
properties.definition: Specifies the UCUM unit for the outcome.

properties.name: studyEffectiveDescription
properties.short: What time period does the study cover
properties.definition: A narrative description of the time period the study covers.

properties.name: studyEffective[x]
properties.short: What time period does the study cover
properties.definition: Indicates what effective period the study covers.

properties.name: studyEffectiveTimeFromStart
properties.short: Observation time from study start
properties.definition: Indicates duration from the study initiation.

properties.name: studyEffectiveGroupMeasure
properties.short: mean | median | mean-of-mean | mean-of-median | median-of-mean | median-of-median
properties.definition: Indicates how elements are aggregated within the study effective period.

properties.name: participantEffectiveDescription
properties.short: What time period do participants cover
properties.definition: A narrative description of the time period the study covers.

properties.name: participantEffective[x]
properties.short: What time period do participants cover
properties.definition: Indicates what effective period the study covers.

properties.name: participantEffectiveTimeFromStart
properties.short: Observation time from study start
properties.definition: Indicates duration from the participant's study entry.

properties.name: participantEffectiveGroupMeasure
properties.short: mean | median | mean-of-mean | mean-of-median | median-of-mean | median-of-median
properties.definition: Indicates how elements are aggregated within the study effective period.

searchParameters.name: composed-of
searchParameters.description: What resource is being referenced

searchParameters.name: context
searchParameters.description: A use context assigned to the research element definition

searchParameters.name: context-quantity
searchParameters.description: A quantity- or range-valued use context assigned to the research element definition

searchParameters.name: context-type
searchParameters.description: A type of use context assigned to the research element definition

searchParameters.name: date
searchParameters.description: The research element definition publication date

searchParameters.name: depends-on
searchParameters.description: What resource is being referenced

searchParameters.name: derived-from
searchParameters.description: What resource is being referenced

searchParameters.name: description
searchParameters.description: The description of the research element definition

searchParameters.name: effective
searchParameters.description: The time during which the research element definition is intended to be in use

searchParameters.name: identifier
searchParameters.description: External identifier for the research element definition

searchParameters.name: jurisdiction
searchParameters.description: Intended jurisdiction for the research element definition

searchParameters.name: name
searchParameters.description: Computationally friendly name of the research element definition

searchParameters.name: predecessor
searchParameters.description: What resource is being referenced

searchParameters.name: publisher
searchParameters.description: Name of the publisher of the research element definition

searchParameters.name: status
searchParameters.description: The current status of the research element definition

searchParameters.name: successor
searchParameters.description: What resource is being referenced

searchParameters.name: title
searchParameters.description: The human-friendly name of the research element definition

searchParameters.name: topic
searchParameters.description: Topics associated with the ResearchElementDefinition

searchParameters.name: url
searchParameters.description: The uri that identifies the research element definition

searchParameters.name: version
searchParameters.description: The business version of the research element definition

searchParameters.name: context-type-quantity
searchParameters.description: A use context type and quantity- or range-based value assigned to the research element definition

searchParameters.name: context-type-value
searchParameters.description: A use context type and value assigned to the research element definition
